Description: 
Established in 2013 and located in the beautiful Pacific Northwest, DME Hub is the collaboration of

Link: https://www.dmehub.net/ 
 
Description: 
Established in 2013 and located in the beautiful Pacific Northwest, DME Hub is the collaboration of 
individuals who share the same common goal and core values. Our goal is simple, we want to improve 
the lives of those we serve. Our core values consist of honesty, solid business principles, compassion for 
our customers and employees, and a good old fashioned hard work ethic! We may be new to the scene 
under this company name, but we have over 40 years of combined experience developing our skills and 
knowledge in the area of home medical equipment and supplies. Throughout those years, we have 
identified some key factors in keeping down the costs while offering a high level of service. We run a 
tight ship and pass the savings along to you. 
 
Responsibilities: 
• Attending Daily scrums, sprint planning, Retrospective meetings very actively.

tight ship and pass the savings along to you.

Title: WebMD Symptom Checker

Work Location: Value labs

Description: 
WebMD is an online service that help people to understand health relation information for free.

Symptom Checker is a module of WebMD project. It lets users to select symptoms to learn their health 
problems they might have and learn solutions for specific problems. 
 
Responsibilities:

• Following Agile methodologies very well: delivering work two days before so testers have time to 
test and report any issues if.

• Lots of challenges in Building developing a brand new Vuejs APP

Project #6: (June 2015 to June 2017) 
Title: Avero 
Technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, react js, jQuery, AJAX, JSON and XML. 
Link: http://www.averoinc.com/ 
 
Description:  
Avero is online application that helps restaurants to track their sales, reports, and other business-
related content. This app can be used by restaurants or group of restaurants to track their usage. 
How many sales they made, times etc. Avero app shows all the business-related information

related content. This app can be used by restaurants or group of restaurants to track their usage. 
How many sales they made, times etc. Avero app shows all the business-related information 
regarding a restaurant in graphs, reports so users can easily see how their business is doing. 
 
Project #5 (2015 Jan to 2015 May) 
 
Title: Virgin mobile. (Oakton Global Technologies) 
Technology: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Angular js, jQuery, AJAX, JSON and XML.  
Backend:  asp.net web Api 
Link: https://www.virginmobileusa.com/ 
 
Description:

Oakton Global Technologies in Hyderabad was assigned with this project. And I worked In a UI team 
building and developing this project. 
 
Responsibilities: 
• Redesign and maintain existing internal web application utilizing xml 
• Wrote application-level code to perform functionality using JavaScript 
• We didn’t have to use jQuery to manipulate DOM as we used Angular for Automatic DOM 
manipulation. 
• Wrote lots of custom Services and Directives and filters to implement the requirements of the 
project. 
• Handling all cross-browser compatibility issue, specially supporting in IE7 and IE 8 
• Experience with browser testing, cross-browser compatibility, and cross-platform compatibility. 
• Made sure project is compatible with HTML 5 standards.

Title : Toyota (Oakton Global Technologies) 
Technology : HTML, CSS, JavaScript, ReactJs, jQuery, AJAX, JSON and XML.  
Backend: asp.net web API. 
Link : http://www.toyota.com/cars/

Title : Toyota (Oakton Global Technologies) 
Technology : HTML, CSS, JavaScript, ReactJs, jQuery, AJAX, JSON and XML.  
Backend: asp.net web API. 
Link : http://www.toyota.com/cars/ 
 
 
 
Description: 
This project is built using .net on the backend and Sitecore. But on the front end it’s built using jQuery and 
typescript. This is a website where you can select the cars that you want to buy or learn more about cars 
and their features. 
Responsibilities: 
• Handling all cross-browser compatibility issues, specially supporting in IE7 and IE 8 
• Experience with browser testing, cross-browser compatibility, and cross-platform compatibility. 
• Made sure project is compatible with HTML 5 standards. 
• Debug the application using Firebug to traverse the documents and manipulated the Nodes using 
DOM and DOM Functions. 
• Successfully executed the entire test cases and fixed any bugs/issues identified during the test 
cycles 
 
Project #3 (Nov 2013 – Oct 2014)

Project #3 (Nov 2013 – Oct 2014) 
 
Title : Tour De France. TDF. (Oakton Global Technologies) 
Technology : HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Angular Js, jQuery, AJAX, JSON and XML. 
Backend: asp.net web Api. 
Link : http://www.letour.com 
Description: 
Oakton Global Technologies is a Dimension data company which has good reputation in building software 
in the domain of sports. A Bi-cycle  race  called Tour De  France  takes  place in France  and in most of the 
places in Europe. This is a very popular sport in Europe. Oakton was responsible for building this software 
and has been building it for years. We had to ship TDF project by the end of June as the race starts in July. 
We used angular js all over the project on the UI side. This app was launched on so many domain names

We used angular js all over the project on the UI side. This app was launched on so many domain names 
depending  on  the  type  of  race.  This  app  has  lots  of components  and  subdomains.  Race  Center  and

Commentators app are what our team worked on which parts of app are done by another team member. 
We have a team in Hyderabad-Oakton of 4 UI developers, 2 testers. There is a team in Australia with all 
the .net developers and 3 other UI developers and Tech Leads. We usually had a stand up every day except 
the day when we have either retrospective or sprint planning. During this project development I had to 
work on three components of the website of race center (for users to see the statistics and results of live 
race) and commentators app (for commentators to comment on live race). Those components are Header, 
Stage Navigation, Telemetry, and classifications of winners (jerseys). 
Responsibilities: 
• Built reusable Angular Modules for RC, CA for TDF project. 
• Involved in standup, planning and kickoff meetings 
• We tested every byte of coding using jasmine JavaScript framework 
• Created custom components to remove dependency to reusable across platform.

• We tested every byte of coding using jasmine JavaScript framework 
• Created custom components to remove dependency to reusable across platform. 
• Redesign and maintain existing internal web application utilizing xml and pcxml 
• Wrote application-level code to perform functionality using JavaScript 
• We didn’t have to use jQuery to manipulate DOM as we used Angular for Automatic DOM 
manipulation. 
• Wrote lots of custom Services and Directives and filters to implement the requirements of the 
project. 
• Handling all cross-browser compatibility issue, specially supporting in IE7 and IE 8 
• Experience with browser testing, cross-browser compatibility, and cross-platform compatibility. 
• Made sure project is compatible with HTML 5 standards. 
• Debug the application using Firebug to traverse the documents and manipulated the Nodes using 
DOM and DOM Functions. 
• Successfully executed the entire test cases & fixed any bugs/issues identified during the test 
cycles.

Project #1 (June 2011 – Nov 2013) 
 
Title : Amkai Charts. (SIS India private limited) 
Technologies : HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Angular js, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, XML, 
typescript.  
Backend: asp.net web Api. 
Role : UI and Backend Developer 
Domain : Health Care 
 
Description: 
SIS India private limited acquired Amkai Charts Company. Amkai Charts is a windows application that is 
built for hospitals to store information about patients from the time he joins the hospital till he leaves 
the hospital. This helps the hospital to know what kind of medications the patient has taken and also 
diseases that the person is suffering from. Everything is stored on databases and compliant to HIPPA. 
 
Responsibilities: 
• Attend Scum meetings to learn about the requirements of the project and sprint planning and also 
sprint               retrospective as well.

Responsibilities: 
• Attend Scum meetings to learn about the requirements of the project and sprint planning and also 
sprint               retrospective as well. 
• I had to write backend and also front end for a related task. 
• Check app for cross-browser compatibility, and cross-platform compatibility. 
• Made sure project is compatible with HTML 5 standards. 
• Debug the application using Firebug to traverse the documents and manipulated the Nodes using 
DOM and DOM Functions. 
• Successfully executed the entire test cases and fixed any bugs/issues identified during the test 
cycles.
